text: bria ministry here in Tehran has
announced that President Mahmoud
Ahmadinejad has won the presidential
election in a landslide with 62 point
six percent of the vote against thirty
three percent for his challenger the
reformist mir hossein mousavi that
number in the low 60s pharmadene azad
scarcely varied from about one hour
after the closing of the poll and indeed
the victory of Ahmadinejad was announced
on national news wires within hours of
the closing of the poll that's just one
of the strange suspicious elements that
have driven Mousavi supporters here into
fury another being the shutting down of
all texting communication across the
country the closing of websites the
closing down of newspapers Mousavi early
today put out a statement saying that
what had been demonstrated in the
election was that the Islamic Republic
was now headed by a government of lies
and dictatorship that he would not
accept this quote treason toward the
voters and urged his supporters to fight
on and protest certainly today in the
streets of Tehran what had been the
green wave the green tsunami of support
for mr. Mousavi had been replaced by a
black wave I saw black clad Special
Forces riot police sweeping down narrow
streets in front of mr. Mousavi's
headquarters and sending a very clear
message that this hastily declared
victory for President Ahmadinejad would
have to stand and that no opposition to
it would be accepted I saw women in
tears many women in tears all the hopes
that have been raised in recent days of
democracy in Iran of greater freedom in
Iran seemingly dashed overnight what
lies ahead now is unclear what is clear
is that there's an enormous amount of
tension and
uh knees on the streets of Tehran today
and violence seems to be in the air
demonstrations are being dispersed and
we have had to retreat here to a rooftop
in order to make this video recording
because to do so on the streets would be
to invite a very violent response from
the police Ahmadinejad himself has
declared that he will celebrate tomorrow
and hold a press conference it seems
that very tense days lies ahead and that
for now at least the hopes of some
rapprochement between Iran and the
United States between Iran and the West
have been put on hold this is Roger
Cohen in Tehran
